newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Menem says happy with aides - paper.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Menem says happy with aides - paper.

text.p: Argentine President Carlos Menem, in an interview with Clarin newspaper published Wednesday, said he is happy with his top aides despite allegations linking some of them to corruption cases.

Markets were nervous Tuesday about former Economy Minister Domingo Cavallo's accusations against Interior Minister Carlos Corach, Justice Minister Elias Jassan and presidential chief of staff Alberto Kohan.
Argentine Brady bonds weakened on rumors one of them was set to quit. They denied the rumors.
"There are no resignations from anyone and I have asked no one to quit," Menem said in the interview. "I am very happy with my aides."

Cavallo has said Corach and Jassan covered up corruption and manipulated judges. He reportedly told a judge Monday that Kohan knew that bribes were allegedly paid to secure a contract for IBM to install a computer system in state-run Banco Nacion. They have denied the allegations.
